soc.robot

Class SOCPossibleCity

  • java.lang.Object
    • soc.robot.SOCPossiblePiece
      • soc.robot.SOCPossibleCity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class SOCPossibleCity
extends SOCPossiblePiece
    This is a possible city that we can build

    If serializing and deserializing this piece, remember the Player and SOCBuildingSpeedEstimateFactory fields will be null when deserialized: Call SOCPossiblePiece.setTransientsAtLoad(SOCPlayer, SOCPlayerTracker) to set them.

    Author:
    Robert S Thomas
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • speedup

        protected int[] speedup
        Speedup per building type. Indexed from SOCBuildingSpeedEstimate.MIN to SOCBuildingSpeedEstimate.MAXPLUSONE.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SOCPossibleCity

        public SOCPossibleCity(SOCPlayer pl,
                       int co,
                       SOCBuildingSpeedEstimateFactory bseFactory)
        constructor
        Parameters:
        pl - the owner; not null
        co - coordinates; not validated
        bseFactory - factory to use for SOCBuildingSpeedEstimate in updateSpeedup() calls; not null

      • SOCPossibleCity

        public SOCPossibleCity(SOCPossibleCity pc)
        copy constructor. Note: This will not copy pc's lists, only make empty ones.
        Parameters:
        pc - the possible city to copy

    • Method Detail

      • updateSpeedup

        public void updateSpeedup()
        calculate the speedup that this city gives. Call when any player's new city or settlement is added to the board.
        See Also:
        getSpeedup()

      • getSpeedup

        public int[] getSpeedup()
        Returns:
        the speedup for this city

      • getSpeedupTotal

        public int getSpeedupTotal()
        Returns:
        the sum of all of the speedup numbers
